Cantera 1.5.0 is now available at the SourceForge site.

What's new:

-- surface chemistry
     - reversible or irreversible reactions
     - coverage-dependent rates; reaction order can be specified
-- flames in Matlab, including
     - burner-stabilized flames
     - non-premixed opposed-jet flames
     - stagnation flows with surface chemistry
-- surface reactions on walls of zero-D reactors
-- new input file format
-- chemical equilibrium with charged species

New Matlab examples include
-- steady-state catalytic combustion of a lean methane/air mixture on Pt
-- a non-premixed C2H6/air flame at 1 atm (some convergence issues; may fail on 
some platforms) 
-- a low-pressure burner-stabilized hydrogen flame

For now only the unix source distribution is available.  Windows binaries will be 
delayed ~2 weeks (unless someone else is interested in making the necessary 
changes to the Windows build procedure). 

Documentation is, as always, in the works. 

Let me know if you run into problems.
Dave
